website_summaries.verdict: The Acer XG270HU is a sharp-looking 27-inch gaming monitor that uses AMD's FreeSync technology to deliver smooth gaming performance.
cons: Middling color and grayscale performance in our tests

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: As of 1/15/19, this monitor is now G-Sync compatible and is certified as such by Nvidia. Pros: - Arrived in perfect condition, no stuck or dead pixels - Looks amazing and has a very low response time - rich colors, looks fine from weird angles - inexpensive considering what it is Cons: - Not a standard mount, you have to buy an adapter to use with another mount - speaker quality is terrible, worse than my phone. Recommend headset or independent speakers.
customer_reviews.author: toledos

customer_reviews.title: Probably one of the better displays you can get in this price range
customer_reviews.text: My roommate bought one of these and he loves it. I got one for myself after sending back two bad monitors of another brand. Alas, this Acer I got had a stuck pixel out of the box. Sent it back and hoping the next one looks good (4th time's a charm?) Aside from the pixel the picture on this was pretty great. update: replacement unit was initially displaying nothing but colored vertical stripes. Swapped some cables and it displayed correctly so I'm not sure if it was just a matter of swapping the DP cable or if it figured itself out after warming up,but it STILL had a stuck pixel. Maybe 3rd time is a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Adair

customer_reviews.title: G-sync compatible!  (it works!)
customer_reviews.text: So far, very pleased with this monitor. Tested it g-sync-compatible with nvidia drivers 419.35 (Gaming-ready-driver) and 419.67 (Creator-ready-driver), with my GTX 1080. So far, not a single glitch. G-sync compatibility seems to work perfectly well with this driver, no flickering or tearing at all. Guess buying a monitor that is listed as officially supported by NVidia pays off. Notes: in case anyone is wondering, in order to make g-sync work on this monitor, Displayport 1.2 must be used (no HDMI support as of this review).
customer_reviews.author: CubOfJudahsLion

customer_reviews.title: and is perfect for both high end gaming
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June 2016, it is now Oct. 2019. Over 3 years now, and this monitor has never failed me. It is crystal clear, produces vivid colors, and is perfect for both high end gaming, and graphic design. I'll never go back to 60hz refresh rate after experiencing 144hz, and I am eagerly saving up to buy a second one of these for a dual monitor set up. Just buy it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Rago

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monitor for a great price. Whites can be a bit grey but everything else looks fantastic. I use it for video editing and a bit of gaming (doom so far) off of my Asus Rog laptop.
customer_reviews.author: edgelimited

customer_reviews.title: Too many FreeSync issues. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it because of all the Freesync issues. Screen goes black during game loads along with flickering. Tried different cables, drivers and system settings. No help. Acer wasn't much help either. Wanted me to ship it back to them even though they were paying the shipping they wouldn't except it unless it was packaged in 3 inches of bubble wrap and a water proof package which i would have to pay for. It was easier to just return it to Amazon and buy a different monitor. I'm sure it would be fine if you're using HDMI but I bought it for Freesync which doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: DoItYourSelfer

customer_reviews.title: Probably more sophisticated than we need but no HDMI cord
customer_reviews.text: The monitor arrived on time and with no damage. It took us a few minutes to figure out that the cables it came with are not compatible with our computers. Apparently the cables are for gaming and we bought it for work and school work. Once I found an HDMI cable from another device we weren't using, the monitor worked great. It swivels from horizontal to vertical very easy and the height adjustment is great. Monitor controls are hard to figure out because there are no instructions explaining what the controls do. Still haven't figured out how to lower the brightness, which is a problem at night.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER TETATZIN

customer_reviews.title: Bang for Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed so far. I'm using this with an RTX 2070 because it's also G-Sync compatible, as advertised by both Acer and nVidia. Setup was a snap, I upgraded my driver and was able to turn G-Sync on without a single hoop to jump through. Picture quality is excellent, I wish the blacks were blacker. It also seems to have a framerate counter built-in which may come in handy. In the box was HDMI, DP, 3.5MM Audio, Power supply and of course monitor and stand. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best.
customer_reviews.text: Lives up to my lofty expectations, worth the price tag due to severe lack of similar monitors currently on the market. The only downside is that it doesn't work eloquently with sub-1080p resolutions, but neither do 99% of the flatscreens out there, and you really shouldn't be using those modes if you're getting a monitor like this anyway. The colors are fairly accurate and overall response times and image are very strong. One of the best gaming monitors currently on the market, especially for the price. The speakers are actually handy in a pinch, I've never minded the inclusion of weak speakers as they can be useful once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: at first, I was a bit worried, the monitor arrived after a week and a half which is very good 144 Hz works perfectly, not sure about the free sync guess I should try it later. the monitor is beautiful I kinda hated the orange lane when I ordered it but let me tell you something the screen is so beautiful and thin, a bit shakey when you want to play with the settings but after you set it up everything is perfect. just read about the monitor online, it has a small problem with colors but if you want a pretty cheap price and well performance such as 144 Hz and 1ms this is the monitor for you
customer_reviews.author: lennypie3

customer_reviews.title: Monitor arrived and worked great upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Monitor arrived and worked great upon arrival, however just after 90 days from purchase, a broken line of blue pixels appeared vertically on the monitor, and I had to send it back for warranty support. Acer would not provide a shipping label and I had to pay fedex ground 75 dollars to send it back to Acer to have it repaired. As of writing this I am still waiting for it to arrive and to see if Acer can at least deliver on repairing or replacing my monitor. Monitor would be good if it worked right, which it didn't, and customer support was lackluster, to say the least. Extremely disappointed and will not be recommending their products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kolozsvary

customer_reviews.title: Some slight stand issues doesn't detract from that great refresh rate
customer_reviews.text: The screen is magnificent. At 144Hz, you can really see the difference when playing fast paced games like Doom and Overwatch. The 2K resolution is a nice bump up from the 1080p screen I was using. It does take some tweaking of the display options to read small text at that resolution. The screen can be a bit wobbly on the stand as the neck only goes in about an inch into the bottom of the screen. Outside of that, this screen is a great budget option if you're looking to play games at a higher resolution and get a higher refresh rate.
customer_reviews.author: Killer_Walrus

customer_reviews.title: 6 Months in and completely satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I don't own an AMD card, but it still works perfectly with a 980ti. I upgraded from a 23" 1080 60hz monitor to this and its night and day. CSGO is so nice in 144fps, and all other games feel smoother even without freesync There is no input delay or ghosting that I can noticeably see (blur busters probably has a comparison out there if you google) The box came with a DisplayPort cable (I'm currently using it), a HDMI cable, an aux cable, and a Dual Link DVI cable This monitor is (as far as I know) the cheapest 1440p 144hz monitor, and if you need more working space AND need a gaming monitor, this is the monitor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after about 16 months  --  the limited warranty is not very good.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor failed after about 16 months. It got artifacts and flashing dots all over and became unusable. I tried it with a few different computers, but it was shot. When I called for warranty service, they told me that it was a "carry-in" warranty, and the only location was in Texas so I would have to pay for shipping. The cost of shipping is going to be about 1/3 the price of the device. Very unsatisfied. Also, I have two Acer monitors and neither one is VESA compliant, so I had to get special equipment to attach it to a decent monitor stand. I have learned my lesson...no more Acer monitors for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ross K.

customer_reviews.title: Great 144hz monitor w/ Freesync, if you have an AMD card, can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my main gaming monitor with another non 144hz monitor as the secondary, and the difference is night and day, especially for FPS. Colors are good for a TN panel, I like the orange/bronze coloring and the thin bezels look great as well. The only issues I've had with it are that a few times when I've left the monitor on for a long time, it will get this weird color warping effect like the monitor just tried to tie-dye a t-shirt but it didn't really follow the instructions on the box correctly and failed. But it's been fixed every time by just turning the monitor on and off. Also, no VESA mount which makes me sad.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D Shimomura

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, poor viewing angle and clarity
customer_reviews.text: While the response times and performance are great, there's one thing I can't shake. This monitor is extremely matte, like someone put sand in my display. The viewing angle also isn't too good, on top of it cannot be adjusted due to the stand, while sturdy, unadjustable. I'll be purchasing the glossy equivalent of this monitor which is also adjustable instead.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its really worth every penny no doubt!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is very nice! I was expecting lesser quality but was wrong. Very well made very sturdy as for the brightness i cant say to much i play in a dark basement. The picture quality is phenomenal. I primarly use it for first person shooter games. Very smooth with the higher refresh rate. Im very happy! You wont regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kamille Kies

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wish there were color options, but this has been a solid monitor for the 3 years I've had it. I don't use free-sync or g-sync normally so I can't really comment on that aspect. It seemed to work alright for me. Only real complaint is the base feels a little flimsy and cheap. The screen itself is great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels at 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: I use these monitors, about 6 hours a day, 3 days a week, at just almost 3 months of using them I have 4 dead pixels on BOTH. Extremely happy with the speed and quality of the images, just not the pixels dying! When I’m spending this kind of money on a Monitor I expect it to last for a while, I had my old ASUS and Acer monitors for 3 years! Defect? Who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Color is fantastic for being a TN panel
customer_reviews.text: I am a big CS:GO player and this monitor is the win! Color is fantastic for being a TN panel. Everything else about this monitor is what you were hoping for. Crisp, clear and bright. Zero motion blur or input lag thanks to the 144hz. Couldn't be happier with this monitor. If you are an FPS player and are still on a 60hz monitor, buy this one with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this monitor for a long time now. It has been with me through 3 different AMD gpu's. I haven't had issues with dead pixels or refresh rates. The monitor for me works as intended. I get 144hz refresh rate and it's freesync compatible. The amd drivers recognize the monitor and it's settings. Besides that, do not use the internal speakers that come with this monitor. If i were to review this product without ignoring the speakers I'd give it a 4 star. But I am assuming people looking for gaming monitors have their own peripheral for audio and didn't have intention from the start to use internal speakers on any monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Polaris

customer_reviews.title: Bugs with display port/FreeSync
customer_reviews.text: Monitor randomly blacks out when using FreeSync with the display port cables, and after installing dedicated monitor driver software from Acer, which fixed the issue, colors for apps like Chrome got screwed up. It probably works fine when not using display port, but considering display port has FreeSync and FreeSync is the reason I bought this monitor, that's pretty unacceptable. QA on this product was nonexistent
customer_reviews.author: Edmond Wu

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying Acer products in the hope they will be worth the money an am consistently disappointed every time. This monitor didn't even last a year before it started cutting out every 20-30 seconds while gaming, and when I switched it to my secondary monitor, it did the exact same thing. Never again. Never trust an Acer product. They cannot build something even remotely reliable, they are cheap for a reason. Never fall into the same trap I have. Their monitors are garbage, their laptops are garbage, they do not make a single quality product. Do not waste your money on this or any Acer monitor.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Best bet is to just stay away from dealing with ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the product a year ago and randomly half the screen no longer works and it costs 298$ to ship it to them to get it fixed. Best bet is to just stay away from dealing with it spent so much money and to claim the warranty it costs about as much as a new monitor entirely...
customer_reviews.author: Nick Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Settings are a little difficult.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor came locked at 60hz and I had to go through the settings to set it to 144hz and I also had to find the setting that was displaying the hz in large numbers at the top right of the screen and that took forever to find. Other than that the monitor is amazing and looks really good too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You might pay for a new monitor and get an open box monitor
customer_reviews.text: Paid for a new item, got an open box item, styrofoam was cracked and broken, box looked as if it was opened previously. It appears to be in good working condition, which is the only reason this isn't a one star review. The monitor itself is good, it's bright and performs well, I was looking for a 1440p 144hz freesync that was certified as g-sync compatible and this fits the requirements nicely. I do recommend the monitor, but I'm still pissed about getting an open box. The first one I received (died to a lightning strike on my house) came in a brand new box.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I’m so happy I decided to give it a chance
customer_reviews.text: FIrst of all I bought this to use with a newly built pc and Xbox one. Right out the box, extremely underwhelming. My eyes wanted to puke because it was hideous. Despite that being said, please please please give it a chance! It took me a day to get the settings right for both pc and Xbox one but omg this monitor has begun to blow me away. I’m so happy I decided to give it a chance. It takes some serious fine tuning but this monitor is solid in both performance and price. Stop reading this review and buy it already!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lacks

customer_reviews.title: It's not the best monitor, but it's very good.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these nearly 2 years ago and have been very happy. For the price, it's a terrific deal. It has good color FOR A TN monitor. It does not compare to IPS, but it doesn't cost as much as an IPS with the same features. The freesync feature works flawlessly and provides for amazingly smooth graphics. If you can afford an IPS panel with all the other bells and whistles that this has, then that's the way to go. For those of us with any kind of budget, this is a great monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for the price. The reactivity is awesome. Coloration is great as long as you follow the tips that other reviews have mentioned. I bought a pair, and they've performed extremely well. FYI you will get 60FPS capped from mini DVI, 120 from HDMI, as I've found through various port options on my video card. I'm several months in and both monitors have been perfect all throughout. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price, playing and having fun.
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was going to be a good monitor since I opened the box. The monitor is really nice, looks like a high end monitor and the base of the monitor feels secure. You can move, adjust and rotate the screen (which I love it for the price). I am currently using the DP cable that comes with the monitor. Be sure your videocard supports DP so you can play at 144hz. Colors are great, they look nice and not dark like other expensive monitors. I am currently playing at 144hz and 1 ms, very happy with it that I want to order a second one. No cons at all. Great monitor for the money in general.
customer_reviews.author: diurnalreign

customer_reviews.title: Horrible colors
customer_reviews.text: Had to shield my eyes when I first plugged it in because the color was absolute garbage. Everything looks so washed out. Adjusting made it somewhat better but still intolerable. The design is nice and 144hz/freesync/response time have no issues. But the stand is flimsy and wobbly. No VESA mount. OSD is a nightmare. Save your money and get a Pixio PX277. 2 Stars because it's usable if you don't care about color accuracy, bu the different is too big vs IPS, even if it's a TN panel.
customer_reviews.author: Hao

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Monitor died in less than 2 months of receiving. Wasn't used regularly and it still crapped out. White screened. I had to pay to ship the damn thing back to get it repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Nox

customer_reviews.title: Great picture at a great frame rate
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my pc and xbox1 can see enemies better and from farther coming from 1080p 60fps this is an amazing improvement
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyj

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no dead pixels. 144hz freesync is amazing. Red is more muted than in the product images.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No dead pixels, no edge bleed or anything like that. Handles 1440p at 144hz with freesync like a dream on my 390x. The red frame isn't nearly as obnoxious in real life - it's a matted off-red that looks much better than the bright red in the pictures on Amazon. Going from 1080p at 60hz to this is night and day, and the screen is huge. Couldn't recommend this more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Monitor for Price; Ergonomics are Tough
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor, especially for the price. The images are crisp. One major downside is that the stand doesn't extend long enough, and the screen doesn't tilt far enough. This has caused some neck pain issues recently.
customer_reviews.author: Brock B.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I've loved this monitor as I got it as a second screen/upgrade to my laptop. The picture is crisp and I noticed the increase in frame rate almost immediately in general activities. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is great.
customer_reviews.text: If you need longer than 3ft cables, you'll have to buy them separately. I've had this monitor for 3 days and it's better than I expected. 144hz 1440p is great. Only problem I had with this monitor is that the back upper left corner wasn't connected. I had to push it down into place, but other than that no problems. No dead pixels. I don't like the stand itself though, it feels flimsy when connecting the monitor to the base. I don't mind the color of the bottom bar but it would've been better in pure black.
customer_reviews.author: Parker L.

customer_reviews.title: Just want to say that this monitor is absolutely amazing! the settings can give you the perfect picture ...
customer_reviews.text: Just want to say that this monitor is absolutely amazing! the settings can give you the perfect picture and 1440p picture is astounding! All my games look great on it with Ultra Settings! The only thing that is a little anooying is that the stand for it is a little big, but still awesome and shouldnt be an issue for people with larger desks. Mine is fairly small and this monitor fits just perfectly lol
customer_reviews.author: eric neuls

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but cheap
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and easy to move around, but the stand isn't adjustable (barely tilts at all, no height adjustment) and the color quality is terrible. 144Hz is nice, but I recommend saving for a 144Hz IPS panel instead if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: Monitor Black Screens Every 5-10 Minutes Until Unplugged And Plugged Back In
customer_reviews.text: The monitor has a good refresh rate and resolution so it looked great while it was still working. I began to play a few games on it and every few minutes the screen would flash black, then go completely black. The monitor wouldn't even turn off with the power button when this happened so I had to unplug it from the back to get it to work again. I tried many fixes for possible issues but it seems that the monitor has issues that cannot be solved by the user. Maybe mine was just a bad monitor but I would not recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Grasman

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my AMD freesync feature. The stand is kind of lame since you can't adjust it vertically or move it at all really except for a little tilting.
customer_reviews.author: Mia R. Mccaulley

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the preformance for this price!
customer_reviews.text: After some adjustments this monitor has great performance, at 144Hz the color gets a little washed out but not too bad, it appears the sweet spot is at 120Hz. I had been waiting for this monitor to hit the stores and at $170. I got a deal! Now it's at least $240.+?? Still worth it for a Free-sync monitor
customer_reviews.author: Moto Guy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing color and quality.
customer_reviews.text: No vesa mount, but in my case i didn't need it. I liked it enough i purchased a second one, than nvidia comes along and says it's gsync compatible. Hooray for not having to pay that gsync tax.
customer_reviews.author: Tim98277

customer_reviews.title: It's a very nice monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I don't claim to be an expert on the technological aspects of monitors, with that being I feel this one is a good purchase mainly for the price, aspect ratio, and refresh rate.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D.

customer_reviews.title: Good value and performance.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it now for a couple of weeks and I love it. I upgraded form an Asus 24in. 60hz. Easy to set up. Comes with a DP, HDMI, and a DVI cable so don't buy a separate one like I did. Clarity is great and the 144hz makes a big difference on fast moving games. One of the best choices for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: brooka

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Gaming monitor. Great quality for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful 144hz freesync monitor. The screen is super tight on the edges and very convenient to setup. The settings are easy to use once you get the hang of it. Guys don't use manuals if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Hexonx

customer_reviews.title: out of the box screen calibration is incredibly bad. I've spent a lot of time trying to ...
customer_reviews.text: out of the box screen calibration is incredibly bad. I've spent a lot of time trying to make it look "good" It has speakers but I can't understand why, cause they're not good, not good at all. The build quality is good and the stand is solid. If you wanna a screen with 144Hz and ok colors then this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Mubarak

customer_reviews.title: I returned mine
customer_reviews.text: Tried this for gaming and content creation, for gaming it was decent but the colors looked off to me, for content creation it wasnt reliable for color.
customer_reviews.author: JaimeGFX

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Love the quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Love the quality. Love the small bezel. Looks like the whole thing is the screen. But the screen starts about a quarter inch in. Hooked up perfectly fine. Comes with every cord you could want and the price was right compared to other 2560x1440p 144hz monitors. I can't complain much. One thing I would change is a sturdier stand. It's not super wobbly but if you bump it, it will bounce 2 or 3 times. But nothing crazy. I had my cat climbing on it and it never fell so that's a plus lol
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor overall is fantastic with good picture quality and the 144hz refresh rate making movement smooth and buttery. The problem, however, is that after 2 years this monitor began power cycling. After a few minutes of use it will start turning itself on and off again and again. The issue ultimately I believe has to do with capacitors in the power supply. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Wolferaz

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor! Due to the fact that there were practically no reviews about this monitor I was a little hesitant about purchasing. After plugging this baby in and powering it up, I'm amazed at the quality. Although it did take me awhile to configure the settings to get the picture just right, it was totally worth the tinkering. Plus, adjusting the default settings is something you should expect to do with any new monitor anyway. Also, I love the stand. Great buy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Omar Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good visuals, bad sound
customer_reviews.text: Used for gaming with a EVGA GTX 1080, achieves high res and high FPS without noticeable artifacts. Audio is terrible. You'll need something else for that. Still, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: veranet

customer_reviews.title: 144hz gaming for a great price!!
customer_reviews.text: Using this as my main gaming monitor right now and I have to say it is very nice. I will admit it is very bright out of the box, but after some calibration it is much better. It doesn't necessarily come with a lot of the extra features you may see on some of the more expensive 144hz gaming monitors, but this still has a great picture. 144hz gaming is such a huge difference from 60hz! I would highly recommend this product simply for it's price to performance ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeb23

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the jump to 144hz.
customer_reviews.text: So far, after about a month with the monitor, I am impressed. Gaming at 144hz is well worth the move, as EVERY game I play between 48-144hz is smooth as butter (thanks FreeSync!). The actual picture quality of the monitor is not the best, with off-coloring and blown out highlights. But the smoothness and price of this monitor make it well worth it for a budget jump to 144hz gaming!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Super smooth. Totally worth the lose of potentially better ...
customer_reviews.text: I set it at 120Hz so I didnt push the boundaries of their upper limits. Super smooth. Totally worth the lose of potentially better pixel density for online fps games. Strongly considering pairing this with a 4k. If you game online its absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor, crazy good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor, crazy good deal for the price, 144hz freesync good colors clear picture. Nice monitor all around no complaints
customer_reviews.author: T. Roe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gaming monitor even for Nvidia Graphics card
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor for the price. Playing games is a pleasure on this monitor. No flickering or stuttering even when played from a Nvidia Graphics. This is one of the monitors which is GSync compatible. Thanks Nvidia enabling.
customer_reviews.author: AkRk

customer_reviews.title: FREESYNC does not work, period.
customer_reviews.text: As with everyone else, i've had the same issue with FREESYNC flashing to a black screen. There has never been a fix or solution found for this problem. Don't anticipate using FREESYNC. After six months of use, it has also developed burnt pixels in the bottom right hand corner of the screen. My time and tabs are all burnt onto the screen now. I would not recommend buying this monitor whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Ingels

customer_reviews.title: Acer XG270HU - Defective Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The monitor has a common manufacturer defect where the screen blinks blank at random points. They have a predator monitor that has the same spec's and it suffers from the same issue. I'm not looking to get stuck with a problem. Sad, since it's really a nice monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Coal_Storm

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: excellent monitor. 1440p @ 144hz perfict gaming minitor not sure whats up with the bad reviews because i have had perfect experience with this. DISPLAY PORT NEEDED FOR 1440p@144hz
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: Monitor is great, very smooth
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is great, very smooth. Very disappointed with Amazon shipping. The monitor I got was used, and everything was opened. Unit was not even packed to ship correctly. Did not return because nothing wrong with it. 5 stars for not being brand new as advertised. Pictures were as it was received
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this Monitor, I originally intended to use it for gaming only, then I just too see how good it was with every day tasks, For School, Watching Videos Etc, etc.. I saw a couple reviews saying it had a "Horrible Display" Boy are those people wrong. After about 30-60 minutes of tweaking, I got the colours looking fantastic! Money Spent Well.

product_meta.description: Style:WQHD (2560 x 1440)| Size:27-InchIn competitive gaming, every frame matters. Introducing Acer's XG Series gaming monitor - the WQHD resolution monitor that can keep up with your game play. Through AMD Free Sync technology, the game's frame rate is determined by your graphics card, not the fixed refresh rate of the monitor, giving you a serious competitive edge. Plus, users can enjoy comfortable viewing experience while gaming via flicker-less, low dimming and Comfy View display. The Zero Frame design saves space on your desk and lets you place multiple monitors side by side to build a seamless big-screen display. feature_bullets: Acer XG 27" monitor features WQHD resolution (2560 x 1440) presenting stunning, high quality images with excellent detail that not only enhances users’ working efficiency, but creates outstanding visual enjoyment.
With AMD Free Sync, the game’s frame rate is determined by your graphics card, not the fixed refresh rate of the monitor, which eliminates screen tearing and delivers very smooth gaming experiences.
Signal Inputs: 1x DVI, 1 x HDMI 2. 0 & 1 x Display Port
A fast response time of 1ms enhances the in-game experience. No matter how fast-moving the action is, transitions are rendered smoothly without the annoying effects of smearing or ghosting.
